name: Effective coaching
description: This path helps you build your skills as a positive communicator and leader. The projects on this path focus on understanding and building consensus, contributing to the development of others by coaching and establishing strong public speaking skills. Each project emphasizes the importance of effective interpersonal communication. This path culminates in a “High Performance Leadership” project of your design.

requiredProjects.name: Ice breaker
requiredProjects.description: This foundational project is designed to introduce you to your club and the skills you need to begin your Toastmasters journey.

requiredProjects.name: Evaluation and feedback
requiredProjects.description: This project addresses the skills needed to give and receive feedback. You will learn about giving, receiving and applying feedback.

requiredProjects.name: Researching and presenting
requiredProjects.description: This project addresses topic selection strategies, suggestions for research and methods for producing a wellorganized speech.

requiredProjects.name: Understanding your leadership style
requiredProjects.description: This project is designed to introduce the different styles of leadership and help you identify your preferred style.

requiredProjects.name: Understanding your communication style
requiredProjects.description: This project focuses on recognizing your preferred communication style and understanding how your style impacts your interactions with others.

requiredProjects.name: Introduction to toastmasters mentoring
requiredProjects.description: This project introduces the value of mentorship and the Toastmasters view of mentors and protégés.

requiredProjects.name: Reaching consensus
requiredProjects.description: This project focuses on reaching consensus and the importance of including all group members in the decision making process.

electiveChoices.name: Deliver social speeches
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the skills needed to compose a speech for a social occasion including a toast, eulogy, an acceptance speech and a speech praising an individual or group.

electiveChoices.name: Using presentation software
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the use of presentation software—from identifying topics that benefit from the use of technology to effective slide design and presentation.

electiveChoices.name: Connect with storytelling
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses storytelling techniques and descriptive skills to help make every speech relatable and interesting.

electiveChoices.name: Creating effective visual aids
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses effective methods for choosing the best visual aid for your presentation along with the creation and use of each type.

electiveChoices.name: Using descriptive language
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the difference between literal and figurative language along with how to determine when to use each to create vivid descriptions.

electiveChoices.name: Connect with your audience
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on different audience types and how to address them effectively.

electiveChoices.name: Make connections through networking
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on how to network effectively and understanding the importance of being a professional ally to people in your network.

electiveChoices.name: Focus on the positive
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses strategies for improving your personal interactions by understanding the impact of your attitudes and thoughts on daily interactions.

electiveChoices.name: Inspire your audience
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how to present a speech in an enthusiastic and inspiring fashion to establish a strong rapport with your audience.

electiveChoices.name: Prepare for an interview
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the skills you need to identify and speak about personal strengths and present yourself well in an interview of any type.

electiveChoices.name: Understanding vocal variety
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the importance of vocal variety when giving a speech and provides activities to develop and nurture its use.

electiveChoices.name: Effective body language
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on how to recognize body language used when speaking publicly and how to use gestures to enhance speech content.

electiveChoices.name: Active listening
electiveChoices.description: This project covers the difference between hearing and listening, and steps for exploring the ways listening helps build strong, lasting connections.

electiveChoices.name: Know your sense of humor
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on understanding what makes you laugh and how to share that with an audience.

requiredProjects.name: Improvement through positive coaching
requiredProjects.description: This project focuses on how your actions can positively affect others and how to nurture relationships and assist an individual in reaching a goal.

electiveChoices.name: Create a podcast
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the skills you need to develop a podcast, create interesting content and organize a cohesive program. You will learn how to record and upload it to the internet.

electiveChoices.name: Building a social media presence
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how best to use different types of online communication. You will create and maintain an online profile to promote yourself or an organization.

electiveChoices.name: Managing a difficult audience
electiveChoices.description: This project covers common behaviors of difficult audience members and how to address each behavior in a calm, effective and professional way.

electiveChoices.name: Write a compelling blog
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the basics of developing a compelling blog and successfully engaging a readership.

electiveChoices.name: Manage online meetings
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how to effectively conduct online meetings and webinars, prepare and organize necessary visual aids, and lead with confidence.

electiveChoices.name: Question and answer session
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how to prepare to answer questions and provide information clearly, concisely and with confidence.

electiveChoices.name: Public relations strategies
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on how to promote awareness of an organization, formulate a public relations strategy and use various public relations tactics.

electiveChoices.name: Manage projects successfully
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on skills needed to effectively manage a project, develop rapport with stakeholders and cultivate strong relationships with a team.

requiredProjects.name: High performance leadership
requiredProjects.description: The focus of this project is to design and complete a project with well-defined goals, lead a team and be accountable to a guidance committee.

requiredProjects.name: Reflect on your path
requiredProjects.description: This project is designed to give you an opportunity to share your experience at the end of your path.

electiveChoices.name: Lessons learned
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how to identify the discussion points of a large group meeting, encourage a culture of contribution and voicing opinions, and facilitate productive discussion that yields results.

electiveChoices.name: Moderate a panel discussion
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the skills needed to successfully moderate a panel discussion and how to be an effective participant on a panel.

electiveChoices.name: Ethical leadership
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the importance of recognizing the effect of decisions that impact ethics, best practices for making ethical decisions and developing an ethical framework.

electiveChoices.name: Leading in your volunteer organization
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on the skills required to lead in a volunteer organization and the importance of recognition and reward in motivating volunteers.

electiveChoices.name: Prepare to speak professionally
electiveChoices.description: This project is designed to help you define the attributes of professional speakers and apply that understanding to your own skills as a speaker.

name: Dynamic Leadership
description: This path helps you build your skills as a strategic leader. The projects on this path focus on understanding leadership and communication styles, the effect of conflict on a group and the skills needed to defuse and direct conflict. These projects also emphasize the development of strategies to facilitate change in an organization or group, interpersonal communication and public speaking. This path culminates in a project focused on applying your leadership skills.

requiredProjects.name: Negotiate the Best Outcome
requiredProjects.description: This project focuses on identifying negotiation styles, engaging in mutually beneficial discussions, and finding and building common ground.

name: Innovative planning
description: This path helps you build your skills as a public speaker and leader. The projects on this path focus on developing a strong connection with audience members when you present, speech writing and speech delivery. The projects contribute to building an understanding of the steps to manage a project, as well as creating innovative solutions. This path culminates in a “High Performance Leadership” project of your design.

name: Leadership development
description: This path helps you build your skills as an effective communicator and leader. The projects on this path focus on learning how to manage time, as well as how to develop and implement a plan. Public speaking and leading a team are emphasized in all projects. This path culminates in the planning and execution of an event that will allow you to apply everything you learned.

requiredProjects.description: This foundational project is designed to introduce you to your club and the skills you need to begin your Toastmasters journey.

name: Motivational strategies
description: This path helps you build your skills as a powerful and effective communicator. The projects focus on learning strategies for building connections with the people around you, understanding motivation and successfully leading small groups to accomplish tasks. This path culminates in a comprehensive team-building project that brings all of your skills together—including public speaking.

electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the basics of developing a compelling blog and successfully engaging a readership.

electiveChoices.name: Manage online meetings
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how to effectively conduct online meetings and webinars, prepare and organize necessary visual aids, and lead with confidence.

electiveChoices.name: Question and answer session
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how to prepare to answer questions and provide information clearly, concisely and with confidence.

electiveChoices.name: Public relations strategies
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on how to promote awareness of an organization, formulate a public relations strategy and use various public relations tactics.

electiveChoices.name: Manage projects successfully
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on skills needed to effectively manage a project, develop rapport with stakeholders and cultivate strong relationships with a team.

requiredProjects.name: Team building
requiredProjects.description: This project addresses the benefits of team building. It is designed to help you build a sense of collaboration and trust within a team completing a project.

requiredProjects.name: Reflect on your path
requiredProjects.description: This project is designed to give you an opportunity to share your experience at the end of your path.

electiveChoices.name: Lessons learned
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how to identify the discussion points of a large group meeting, encourage a culture of contribution and voicing opinions, and facilitate productive discussion that yields results.

electiveChoices.name: Moderate a panel discussion
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the skills needed to successfully moderate a panel discussion and how to be an effective participant on a panel.

electiveChoices.name: Ethical leadership
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the importance of recognizing the effect of decisions that impact ethics, best practices for making ethical decisions and developing an ethical framework.

electiveChoices.name: Leading in your volunteer organization
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on the skills required to lead in a volunteer organization and the importance of recognition and reward in motivating volunteers.

electiveChoices.name: Prepare to speak professionally
electiveChoices.description: This project is designed to help you define the attributes of professional speakers and apply that understanding to your own skills as a speaker.

electiveChoices.name: High performance leadership
electiveChoices.description: The focus of this project is to design and complete a project with well-defined goals, lead a team and be accountable to a guidance committee.

name: Persuasive influence
description: This path helps you build your skills as an innovative communicator and leader. The projects on this path focus on how to negotiate a positive outcome together with building strong interpersonal communication and public speaking skills. Each project emphasizes developing leadership skills to use in complex situations, as well as creating innovative solutions to challenges. This path culminates in a “High Performance Leadership” project of your design.

requiredProjects.name: Ice breaker
requiredProjects.description: This foundational project is designed to introduce you to your club and the skills you need to begin your Toastmasters journey.

requiredProjects.name: Evaluation and feedback
requiredProjects.description: This project addresses the skills needed to give and receive feedback. You will learn about giving, receiving and applying feedback.

requiredProjects.name: Researching and presenting
requiredProjects.description: This project addresses topic selection strategies, suggestions for research and methods for producing a wellorganized speech.

requiredProjects.name: Understanding your leadership style
requiredProjects.description: This project is designed to introduce the different styles of leadership and help you identify your preferred style.

requiredProjects.name: Active listening
requiredProjects.description: This project covers the difference between hearing and listening, and steps for exploring the ways listening helps build strong, lasting connections.

requiredProjects.name: Introduction to toastmasters mentoring
requiredProjects.description: This project introduces the value of mentorship and the Toastmasters view of mentors and protégés.

requiredProjects.name: Understanding conflict resolution
requiredProjects.description: This project is designed to introduce conflict resolution strategies and provide an opportunity to resolve a conflict scenario within an interactive activity.

electiveChoices.name: Deliver social speeches
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the skills needed to compose a speech for a social occasion including a toast, eulogy, an acceptance speech and a speech praising an individual or group.

electiveChoices.name: Using presentation software
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the use of presentation software—from identifying topics that benefit from the use of technology to effective slide design and presentation.

electiveChoices.name: Connect with storytelling
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses storytelling techniques and descriptive skills to help make every speech relatable and interesting.

electiveChoices.name: Creating effective visual aids
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses effective methods for choosing the best visual aid for your presentation along with the creation and use of each type.

electiveChoices.name: Using descriptive language
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the difference between literal and figurative language along with how to determine when to use each to create vivid descriptions.

electiveChoices.name: Connect with your audience
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on different audience types and how to address them effectively.

electiveChoices.name: Make connections through networking
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on how to network effectively and understanding the importance of being a professional ally to people in your network.

electiveChoices.name: Focus on the positive
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses strategies for improving your personal interactions by understanding the impact of your attitudes and thoughts on daily interactions.

electiveChoices.name: Inspire your audience
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how to present a speech in an enthusiastic and inspiring fashion to establish a strong rapport with your audience.

electiveChoices.name: Prepare for an interview
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the skills you need to identify and speak about personal strengths and present yourself well in an interview of any type.

electiveChoices.name: Understanding vocal variety
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the importance of vocal variety when giving a speech and provides activities to develop and nurture its use.

electiveChoices.name: Effective body language
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on how to recognize body language used when speaking publicly and how to use gestures to enhance speech content.

electiveChoices.name: Know your sense of humor
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on understanding what makes you laugh and how to share that with an audience.

requiredProjects.name: Leading in difficult situations
requiredProjects.description: This project focuses on the fundamentals of managing challenges, analyzing difficult situations and identifying best strategies for overcoming adversity.

electiveChoices.name: Create a podcast
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the skills you need to develop a podcast, create interesting content and organize a cohesive program. You will learn how to record and upload it to the internet.

electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how best to use different types of online communication. You will create and maintain an online profile to promote yourself or an organization.

name: Presentation mastery
description: This path helps you build your skills as an accomplished public speaker. The projects on this path focus on learning how an audience responds to you and improving your connection with audience members. The projects contribute to developing an understanding of effective public speaking technique, including speech writing and speech delivery. This path culminates in an extended speech that will allow you to apply what you learned.

name: Strategic relationships
description: This path helps you build your skills as a leader in communication. The projects on this path focus on understanding diversity, building personal and/or professional connections with a variety of people and developing a public relations strategy. Communicating well interpersonally and as a public speaker is emphasized in each project. The path culminates in a project to apply your skills as a leader in a volunteer organization.

name: Team collaboration
description: This path helps you build your skills as a powerful and effective communicator. The projects focus on learning strategies for building connections with the people around you, understanding motivation and successfully leading small groups to accomplish tasks. This path culminates in a comprehensive team-building project that brings all of your skills together—including public speaking.

name: Visionary communication
description: This path helps you build your skills as a strategic communicator and leader. The projects on this path focus on developing your skills for sharing information with a group, planning communications and creating innovative solutions. Speech writing and speech delivery are emphasized in each project. This path culminates in the development and launch of a long-term personal or professional vision.

electiveChoices.description: This project addresses strategies for improving your personal interactions by understanding the impact of your attitudes and thoughts on daily interactions.

electiveChoices.name: Inspire your audience  0
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how to present a speech in an enthusiastic and inspiring fashion to establish a strong rapport with your audience.

electiveChoices.name: Prepare for an interview  0
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the skills you need to identify and speak about personal strengths and present yourself well in an interview of any type.

electiveChoices.name: Understanding vocal variety  0
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the importance of vocal variety when giving a speech and provides activities to develop and nurture its use.

electiveChoices.name: Effective body language  0
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on how to recognize body language used when speaking publicly and how to use gestures to enhance speech content.

electiveChoices.name: Active listening  0
electiveChoices.description: This project covers the difference between hearing and listening, and steps for exploring the ways listening helps build strong, lasting connections.

electiveChoices.name: Know your sense of humor  0
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on understanding what makes you laugh and how to share that with an audience.

requiredProjects.name: Communicate change
requiredProjects.description: This project focuses on creating a communication plan by gathering evidence to support the need for change and communicating change with your audience.

electiveChoices.name: Create a podcast  0
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the skills you need to develop a podcast, create interesting content and organize a cohesive program. You will learn how to record and upload it to the internet.

electiveChoices.name: Building a social media presence  0
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how best to use different types of online communication. You will create and maintain an online profile to promote yourself or an organization.

electiveChoices.name: Managing a difficult audience  0
electiveChoices.description: This project covers common behaviors of difficult audience members and how to address each behavior in a calm, effective and professional way.

electiveChoices.name: Write a compelling blog  0
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the basics of developing a compelling blog and successfully engaging a readership.

electiveChoices.name: Manage online meetings  0
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how to effectively conduct online meetings and webinars, prepare and organize necessary visual aids, and lead with confidence.

electiveChoices.name: Question and answer session  0
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how to prepare to answer questions and provide information clearly, concisely and with confidence.

electiveChoices.name: Public relations strategies  0
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on how to promote awareness of an organization, formulate a public relations strategy and use various public relations tactics.

electiveChoices.name: Manage projects successfully  0
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on skills needed to effectively manage a project, develop rapport with stakeholders and cultivate strong relationships with a team.

requiredProjects.name: Develop your vision
requiredProjects.description: This project focuses on developing a vision for your work or personal life.

requiredProjects.name: Reflect on your path  0
requiredProjects.description: This project is designed to give you an opportunity to share your experience at the end of your path.

electiveChoices.name: Lessons learned  0
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses how to identify the discussion points of a large group meeting, encourage a culture of contribution and voicing opinions, and facilitate productive discussion that yields results.

electiveChoices.name: Moderate a panel discussion  0
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the skills needed to successfully moderate a panel discussion and how to be an effective participant on a panel.

electiveChoices.name: Ethical leadership  0
electiveChoices.description: This project addresses the importance of recognizing the effect of decisions that impact ethics, best practices for making ethical decisions and developing an ethical framework.

electiveChoices.name: High performance leadership  0
electiveChoices.description: The focus of this project is to design and complete a project with well-defined goals, lead a team and be accountable to a guidance committee.

electiveChoices.name: Leading in your volunteer organization  0
electiveChoices.description: This project focuses on the skills required to lead in a volunteer organization and the importance of recognition and reward in motivating volunteers.

electiveChoices.name: Prepare to speak professionally  0
electiveChoices.description: This project is designed to help you define the attributes of professional speakers and apply that understanding to your own skills as a speaker.

name: Engaging humor
description: This path is designed to help you build your skills as a humorous and engaging public speaker. The projects on this path focus on understanding your sense of humor and how that sense of humor translates to engaging audience members. The projects contribute to developing an understanding of how to effectively use humor in a speech, including challenging situations and impromptu speeches. This path culminates in an extended humorous speech that will allow you to apply what you learned.

requiredProjects.name: Ice breaker
requiredProjects.description: This foundational project is designed to introduce you to your club and the skills you need to begin your Toastmasters journey.

requiredProjects.name: Evaluation and feedback
requiredProjects.description: This project addresses the skills needed to give and receive feedback. You will learn about giving, receiving and applying feedback.

requiredProjects.name: Researching and presenting
requiredProjects.description: This project addresses topic selection strategies, suggestions for research and methods for producing a wellorganized speech.

requiredProjects.description: This project focuses on different audience types and how to address them effectively.

requiredProjects.description: This project introduces the value of mentorship and the Toastmasters view of mentors and protégés.

requiredProjects.description: This project focuses on using humor to enhance the message you deliver in your speech.
